analyzeResult.content:
RJR
Interoffice Memorandum
Subject: Testing Procedures for NFO and Phase I Products
Date : May 26, 1982
To: Mr. H. C. Threatt
From: C. L. Manning
A meeting was held on May 25 in Mr. J. D. Phillips conference room to - discuss sampling and testing procedures that can be used to obtain more meaningful data during the transfer of products from R&D to Manu- facturing. The following people were in attendance: Pat Vestal, Don Calleson, Hal Guess, Bobby Hardin, Jerry Lawson, Charles Manning, Dan Pugh, Aubrey Thacker, Harold Threatt, Jr., Jim Weiss, and Ron Willard.
Everyone at the meeting agreed that to put together a valid sampling and testing plan, the assistance of a statistician would be needed. The Maintenance Division will obtain the assistance of a statistician and initiate a protocol. However, it was felt that it would take several weeks to initiate the protocol and that some type of extra testing must be implemented at once. The following testing was agreed on.for NFO and Phase I runs as an interim step until a detailed protocol can be initiated:
1. Wt. vs. firmness tests (target, light & heavy)
2. Tipping porosity ranges (target, low & high)
3. Sieve analysis (after making)
4. Filling capacity (after making)
5. Three composite samples will be taken at random during the run at optimum conditions and the following data collected:
Weight Draft (assembled cig., holes closed cig. and encapulated filter tip)
Size
Firmness
. Percent dilution (Filtrona or ITR)
Rod draft
Tar & nicotine (port by port analysis) Pack menthol (if applicable)
· Pack moisture
· Percent G-13
Standard deviations will be determined on parameters measured individually. The first seven parameters will also be checked on the wt. vs. firmness and porosity range samples.
CLM:bm cc: Ms. P. W. Vestal Mr. F. A. Thacker
C. L. Manning
51235 6697
AJRI FORM 2422-Rev. 7/70
